conbody.p: PollingPolling is a mode for polling the students or conducting a quick and simple multiple choice pop quiz without invoking the full quiz system (see ).
Press the Interact button and select Poll from the class (see ) or group (see ) menu to to initiate polling of a group of students or if the whole class.
Poll management window ( ) will appear on your screen.

row.entry: Start/Stop button to start and stop polling.
Question panel for specifying the poll question.
Save the poll for future use.
Drop down list with common sets of responces.
Start a new poll with default settings .

conbody.p: To create a new poll: enter your question in field (3), select one of the commonly used sets of responces from the drop down list (10) or add answer options as necessary using buttons (12). Optionally, you can designate one of the responces as the correct one (for pop quizzes). You can save the poll for future using button (4) ( ) and open a previously saved poll using button (5).

Press the Start button to initiate polling (at this point it will be replaced by a Stop button and the Chart tab ( ) will be autoselected). A polling window ( ) will appear on the student screens. Students should make their selections and press Send to register their responces.
conbody.note: Please note that titles of the group(s) where you are conducting the poll will be dispalyed in red for the duration of the poll.
conbody.p: You can monitor the poll in real time in the Chart tab ( ). Poll results are represented as a histogram bar chart with each bin corresponding to every answer option. The chart is updated as soon as results arrive. Progress bar below the bar chart indicates fraction of the students who have already responded to the poll. You can press the Stop button at any time to terminate the poll.

You can view detailed results of the poll in the Results tab ( ) that will be autoselected either when you terminate the poll by pressing the Stop button or the poll finishes when all the students have responded. This tab contains a detailed list of responces to the poll:

ol.li: An indicator whether selected option is correct (if the poll had one designated)

conbody.p: You can generate a report of the poll results in HTML format, convenient for viewing, printing, and posting online. Press the Save report button, specify report file name, and press Save. You will be prompted if you would like to view the report. The report ( ) will be opened in a new window of your default web browser (usually Microsoft Internet Explorer).
